main event: Multiple sightings of an unidentified flying object (UFO) were reported near New London, Connecticut on June 24, 1953. The object was described as cigar-shaped and seen by pilots at various altitudes and times.
interesting points: The object appeared to burst into flames, break into two pieces, and extinguish itself before dropping into the ocean, according to multiple witnesses.
A mid-air collision of two unidentified objects over Rhode Island was reported only a few days later, on June 23, 1953.
Supplementary information revealed that the incident involving a bright light hovering and accelerating out of sight was concluded to be an aircraft after interrogation of pilots.
The document also includes a letter from the American Airlines detailing an observation made by a pilot while operating flight 359, describing the sighting of a strange object in the sky.
There were requests for radar sightings analysis and additional details from witnesses to be submitted to the Air Technical Intelligence Center and other relevant organizations.
result: The conclusion of the report identified the sighting as an aircraft, and the incident involving the mid-air collision was not clearly identified as a UFO.
sighted object: Cigar-shaped UFO and unidentified flying objects near New London, Connecticut
witnesses: Pilots at various altitudes and American Airlines flight crew
photographs: No photographs were included in the report
